pages.text: The ability wand is an optional tool you may use during your battles. You may have noticed that many ships come with an active ability that you can use. This is where the ability wand comes into play. When $(thing)Right clicked$(clear) on a $(thing)ship$(clear), it will select that ship's active ability provided that the ship meets these 3 criteria:$(li)It actually has an active ability.

$(li)The ability has at least one use left.$(li)The ship is not destroyed.$(clear)$(br2)When an ability is succfully selected, you may need to first select a location to cast it on since most active abilities need a board tile to target. Selecting a target can be done by going to a board tile (either one of your own tiles or an opponent tile depending on the ability), and use the ability wand on the tile. This will highlight the area that

the ability will target. Once the ability (and possibly target area) are selected, you can then $(thing)Right click$(clear) the $(l:game_requirements/game_controller)$(item)Game Controller$(clear) to cast the ability (provided you have enough $(l:naval_warfare:misc/energy)Energy/$). Note that if your chosen ability is one that will attack opponent tiles, then your turn will be ended if the ability does not hit any ships. If the ability does not attack any opponent tiles, then you may continue your turn.
